title: Job Openings at Molaprise
content:
Molaprise, headquartered in New York with a global reach, is a rising-leader in technology consulting and cloud services. We specialize in cybersecurity, cloud adoption, and infrastructure modernization, delivering secure and agile solutions trusted by financial and US government sectors. We strive to make advanced technology accessible, driving business and public sector success. With top-tier partnerships, our seasoned team offers tailored cloud strategies to exceed expectations, ensuring that with Molaprise, your digital transformation journey leads to tangible, superior outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Director, Technology Consulting & Systems Integration - Africa
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job No.: 61
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	Molaprise is seeking a Senior Consulting Manager or Director to lead and scale our Technology Consulting & Systems Integration Practice across Ghana, Nigeria, and offshore markets.
	This role is a rare opportunity to bridge Africa’s immense potential with global enterprise-grade delivery.
	You’ll drive innovation across finance, energy, healthcare, and the public sector, build AI-powered platforms, and position Africa as a global digital leader.


Why This Role Matters — For You and for Africa


	Africa is transforming. From modernizing banks and automating agribusiness to building AI-driven public services, the opportunity is enormous.
	At Molaprise, we’re launching Africa’s top talent into global tech delivery—designing and executing world-class solutions from Africa, for the world.


This is more than a job—it’s a mission to:


	Build a world-class consulting practice in Africa
	Lead large-scale enterprise transformation initiatives
	Mentor the next generation of AI and engineering talent
	Deliver cutting-edge systems across sectors
	Shape Africa’s digital innovation narrative


Key Responsibilities
Practice Leadership & Strategic Growth:


	Define the vision and roadmap for consulting and systems integration across Africa.
	Grow vertical-specific solutions in:
	
		Financial Services: Core banking modernization, fraud prevention
		Public Sector: National ID systems, digital citizen platforms
		Healthcare: Telehealth, smart diagnostics, data interoperability
		Energy/Utility: IoT grid monitoring, predictive analytics
	
	
	Build a multi-million-dollar pipeline targeting mid-to-enterprise clients ($10M–$300M in revenue).


Sales Engineering & Market Expansion:


	Lead technical pre-sales, solutioning, and RFP responses.
	Co-develop offerings with partners (Microsoft, AWS, Cisco, OpenAI).
	Drive regional campaigns, events, and briefings to enhance visibility.
	Support high-value deal closures alongside account executives.


Global Delivery & Offshore Engineering:


	Build and manage a cross-border engineering hub for U.S. clients.
	Deliver MVPs, multi-cloud migrations, and enterprise-grade integrations.
	Ensure alignment across U.S.–Africa projects, especially in cloud and cybersecurity.


Team Building & Culture Crafting:


	Recruit and mentor engineers, architects, consultants, and project managers across Africa.
	Foster a culture of agility, excellence, and accountability.
	Champion Molaprise’s mission to transform Africa’s digital infrastructure.


Requirements
What We’re Looking For:


	10+ years of experience leading tech consulting, SI practices, or offshore/global delivery teams.
	Deep expertise in cloud (Azure, AWS), enterprise AI, DevOps, and systems integration.
	Proven ability to translate technical complexity into business value and close transformation deals.
	Passion for building in high-growth, resource-constrained environments.
	Strong communicator who can engage C-suite and engineering teams alike.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with African tech implementations (e.g., national ID, healthcare access, fintech platforms).
	Understanding of African regulatory frameworks (NDPR, GIPC Act, etc.).
	Certifications: CISSP, Azure Solutions Architect, AWS Pro, CCIE, TOGAF, etc.
	Experience working with governments, banks, telcos, or regional enterprises.
	Previous delivery experience with U.S.-based clients from offshore hubs.


Why Join Molaprise Africa


	Pan-African Impact: Drive digital transformation across West Africa and beyond.
	High Ownership: Influence strategy, team growth, and execution.
	Innovative Work: Build real-world AI, automation, and cloud solutions.
	Results-Driven Culture: Grit, honesty, execution, and customer obsession.
	Competitive Compensation: Strong base + performance bonus; equity may be offered.
	Autonomy: Lead from the front with full ownership of outcomes.
	Build Africa-Grown IP: Architect AI agents, automation systems, and industry-focused platforms.


Salary
DOE

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) DevOps & Cloud Engineer

Job No.: 57
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the Role


	We’re seeking a versatile DevOps & Cloud Engineer who thrives on solving infrastructure challenges and believes automation unlocks innovation.
	In this role, you’ll design, build, and maintain secure, scalable, and reliable systems that power our products.
	You’ll be instrumental in shaping cloud strategy, driving DevOps culture, and ensuring system resilience for growth.


What You'll Do
Cloud Infrastructure Design & Management:


	Architect, deploy, and maintain scalable and secure infrastructure on AWS and/or Azure
	Implement infrastructure-as-code practices (Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar) for consistency and repeatability
	Optimize cloud resource usage to balance performance, cost, and reliability


CI/CD & Automation:


	Build, manage, and improve CI/CD pipelines for seamless deployment and rollback
	Automate repetitive operational tasks to reduce manual overhead and increase efficiency
	Enable rapid development cycles while maintaining system stability and security


Monitoring, Logging & Reliability:


	Set up observability frameworks: logging, metrics, alerts, and dashboards
	Proactively detect and resolve performance bottlenecks and system outages
	Drive reliability engineering practices to ensure uptime, scalability, and resilience


Security & Compliance:


	Identify, assess, and mitigate security vulnerabilities across cloud environments and applications
	Implement security-first practices in cloud deployments, data handling, and access control
	Conduct regular audits and updates to maintain a secure infrastructure.


What You Bring


	3+ years of hands-on experience managing cloud infrastructure and DevOps workflows
	Proficiency with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or similar)
	Strong experience with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Ansible, or equivalent)
	A security-first mindset with a passion for automation and continuous improvement
	Exposure to multi-tenant SaaS architecture or distributed systems is a strong plus


Why Join Us?


	Work with a high-performing engineering team on infrastructure that scales globally
	Hybrid flexibility with opportunities for part-time or full-time engagement
	Ownership of critical DevOps decisions shaping the company’s growth trajectory
	Competitive compensation and a culture that values automation, security, and innovation.


Salary
DOE

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) AI / ML Engineer

Job No.: 59
Job Location: Lagos, 
Job type: Full-time / Consultant 

About the Role


	We’re seeking a curious and data-driven AI/ML Engineer who thrives on uncovering patterns where others see noise.
	You’ll join a small, high-trust team focused on applying AI/ML in novel, real-world contexts.
	Your work will go beyond experiments — you’ll help design intelligent systems that learn, adapt, and evolve in production environments.


What You'll Do
Model Development & Experimentation:


	Research, design, and train machine learning models for predictive analytics, anomaly detection, and optimization tasks
	Build prototypes and run experiments to validate hypotheses and model performance
	Continuously refine algorithms for accuracy, scalability, and efficiency


Data Analysis & Insights:


	Explore large, complex datasets to uncover actionable insights
	Translate findings into features, signals, and improvements that enhance product functionality
	Ensure data quality, integrity, and preprocessing pipelines for ML readiness


Cross-Functional Collaboration:


	Work closely with product managers, engineers, and domain experts to integrate models into production systems
	Communicate complex ML concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
	Support ongoing monitoring, evaluation, and retraining of deployed models


Deployment & Optimization:


	Implement scalable ML solutions in real-world environments
	Leverage cloud ML platforms and APIs for training, deployment, and monitoring
	Optimize runtime performance to balance accuracy, speed, and cost


What You Bring


	3+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning, applied AI, or data science
	Strong proficiency in Python and libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
	Demonstrated ability to design experiments, analyze results, and iterate quickly
	Comfort working independently in unstructured problem spaces and ambiguous environments
	A mindset of curiosity, experimentation, and continuous learning


Why Join Us?


	Be part of a phase 2 initiative, applying AI/ML to cutting-edge, real-world problems
	Work in a high-trust, collaborative environment where your contributions drive impact
	Hybrid flexibility with consultant or full-time options
	Competitive compensation and opportunities for ownership of AI/ML strategy


Salary
DOE

Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Sendtins Nigeria Limited is&nbsp;recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer (Partnerships)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Do you have the grit and drive to connect an innovative tech platform with the realities of the Nigerian logistics market? We are looking for a highly tenacious Operations Officer, Partnerships to be the external face of SendTins.
	Your primary mission is to aggressively secure and maintain the key partnerships that drive our transaction volume and market expansion.
	If you have what it takes to shine at an exciting and interesting startup with massive opportunities for growth, we want to hear from you.


Job Responsibilities


	Partner Acquisition &amp; Negotiation: Aggressively identify, pitch, negotiate, and onboard crucial logistics partners, including motor park agents, haulage companies, and independent drivers across Lagos and surrounding states.
	Vendor &amp; Partner Management: Serve as the primary liaison for all external vendors and partners. Ensure relationships are productive, profitable, and compliant.
	Presentation &amp; Pitching: Conduct ongoing market research and use insights to confidently deliver high-impact presentations and pitches to potential partners and stakeholders.
	Field Strategy: Spend significant time (60%+) in the field, conducting market intelligence and managing agent relationships to hit onboarding targets.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Education: BSc or HND in Marketing, Business Administration, or any related field.
	Experience: A minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in vendor management, channel sales, or partnership acquisition.
	Skills: Proven expertise in pitching, negotiation, and building trust in professional and field environments. Expert use of Office/GSuite for compelling presentations and reporting.


Benefits
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to your well-being:


	Competitive Salary (N250,000 - N300,000 monthly)&nbsp;&amp; Performance Bonus Structure
	HMO Coverage
	Pension Contributions.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to:&nbsp;hr@oaklandsandjohnson.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the&nbsp;email.&nbsp;",

        Sendtins Nigeria Limited is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer (Partnerships)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

	Do you have the grit and drive to connect an innovative tech platform with the realities of the Nigerian logistics market? We are looking for a highly tenacious Operations Officer, Partnerships to be the external face of SendTins.
	Your primary mission is to aggressively secure and maintain the key partnerships that drive our transaction volume and market expansion.
	If you have what it takes to shine at an exciting and interesting startup with massive opportunities for growth, we want to hear from you.


Job Responsibilities


	Partner Acquisition & Negotiation: Aggressively identify, pitch, negotiate, and onboard crucial logistics partners, including motor park agents, haulage companies, and independent drivers across Lagos and surrounding states.
	Vendor & Partner Management: Serve as the primary liaison for all external vendors and partners. Ensure relationships are productive, profitable, and compliant.
	Presentation & Pitching: Conduct ongoing market research and use insights to confidently deliver high-impact presentations and pitches to potential partners and stakeholders.
	Field Strategy: Spend significant time (60%+) in the field, conducting market intelligence and managing agent relationships to hit onboarding targets.

	Education: BSc or HND in Marketing, Business Administration, or any related field.
	Experience: A minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in vendor management, channel sales, or partnership acquisition.
	Skills: Proven expertise in pitching, negotiation, and building trust in professional and field environments. Expert use of Office/GSuite for compelling presentations and reporting.


Benefits

Method of Application
